intro: Irvingella boto, commonly known as the Boto tree, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, colorful flowers. The plant produces woody pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Irvingella boto thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and potential medicinal research.
